result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan William Montney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $3651.17 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $365.12 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
NO CONTACT WITH  MORTENSON BROS. FARM AND/OR PLAINFIELD TRAVEL PLAZA. DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY.  NO PHONE CALLS, E-MAILS, TEXT MESSAGES, WRITTEN COMMUNICATIONS OR BY THIRD PARTY.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Court does not object to jail transfer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Waushara County Jail-Inmate request to the court
Restitution check returned by USPS - Re-mailed to victim

9:20 am case called. Defendant Ryan William Montney in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record-State moves to amend Count 1 to Misd. Theft, Repeater & Count 2-Bail Jumping-Misd., Repeater. Attorney Ulrich concurs with recitation of agreement.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts motion for amendment by State. Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 1 only- 60 days WCJ, to commence no later than August 1, 2016- with Huber. No objection to jail transfer.  CONDITIONS ON EACH COUNT: No Contact with Mortenson Brothers Farms & Plainfield Travel Plaza. Terms of Agent. Restitution of $3651.17, paid. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
from Atty Ulrich Re: Request to Adjourn P/S on 5/11/2016
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ulrich requests additional time for defendant to pay restitution.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:55 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:03 PM:  Defendant Ryan William Montney in court, appearing in person, with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Def agrees to his counsel appearing via telephone today, due to inclement weather.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
